column4: Anybody familiar with regexps here? What do the \( and )\ do ?
mew I always see \(...\) together?
sorry it is \) and not )\
because?
without the escapes...
just enough to make 64bit tempting
:( that's real bad.. I was wondering somebody would say "not so much" and I wouldn't feel guilty about the fact that I am not able to get my wireless LAN card working on that (BCM 4318)
the problems of 64 bit outweigh the benefits in my book
hmm.. do you know perhaps where I could get 64bit drivers? Or could I make my wireless card work under a 32bit chroot using ndiswrapper and Windows drivers?
you wont get _drivers_ working in a chroot. Your kernel remains 64 bit.
aaaa I was afraid of that. Oh well, looks like I will wait till I am able to buy a 64bit desktop
you could buy a new nic...
oh yeah didn't think of that :) .. let's see.. so do you have any suggestions for external (PCMCIA perhaps, or USB) wireless NICs that have native 64bit support under Linux (Particularly Ubuntu)>
no experience, i'm afraid. You'd imagine the opensource drivers (such as ralink) would compile under 64bit
good luck
probably. You can run vmware workstation on 64 bit
I want to run the free version that is available online :)
yes, but that has come out after workstation, so will probably work
ok thanks :)
it would probably work, but isn't there a better way?
I thought he said he didn't want to reboot ... reboot should be the final option on any Unix box.
i agree
